content.prompt: ​A certain type of machine produces a number of amps of electricity that follows a cyclic, periodically increasing and decreasing pattern. The machine produces a maximum of  7{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} amps at certain times and a minimum of 2{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} amps at other times. It takes about 5{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} minutes for one cycle from 7{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} amps to the next 7{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} amps to occur. Which of the following graphs models amps as a function of time, in minutes, for this machine?

choices.label:
• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at point (negative 1 comma 2.5).
    • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at (1 comma 7).
    • The curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point at approximately (3.4 comma 2).
    • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at (6 comma 7).
    • The curve trends down gradually to the right and ends at point (8 comma 2.5).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option A. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at point (negative 1 comma 3.2).
    • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at approximately (0 comma 7). 
    • The curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point at approximately (1.2 comma 2). 
    • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at approximately (2.5 comma 7).
    • The curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point at approximately (3.8 comma 2).
    • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at approximately (5 comma 7).
    • The curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point at approximately (6.2 comma 2).
    • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at approximately (7.4 comma 7).
    • The curve trends down gradually and ends at approximately (8 comma 5.4).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option B. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right: 
    • The curve begins at point (negative 1 comma 6.8).
    • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at (0 comma 7).
    • The curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point at approximately (5 comma 2).
    • The curve trends up gradually to the right and ends at point (8 comma 5.1).

​

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option C. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at point (negative 1 comma 2).
    • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at (1 comma 7).
    • The curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point at approximately (3 comma 2).
    • The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at (5 comma 7).
    • The curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point approximately at (7 comma 2).
    • The curve trends up to the right and ends at point (8 comma 4.2).

​

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option D. Refer to its long description

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
